results.title: The West wing. Season 1. Eps. 20-22
results.brief_description: Episodes 20-22 of the first season of the much awarded and critically acclaimed US television series about the behind-the-scenes machinations of White House. Season One introduces Nobel Prize-winning economist and unabashed intellectual president Jed Bartlet and his key staff members, a newly elected Democratic administration trying to find its footing amidst the corridors of the White House’s west wing. The series is driven by its artful, intelligent, rapid-fire dialogue from the pen of creator, co-executive producer and screenwriter Aaron Sorkin (who also scripted ‘A Few Good Men’, ‘The American President’ and ‘Malice’), delivered by an exceptional ensemble cast. Plotlines centre on the daily challenges faced by the highly strung, over-ambitious staff closest to the president - the press secretary, chief of staff, deputy chief of staff, and deputy communications director - who carry on most of their frenetically paced, but always articulate, conversations while striding purposefully through the corridors and offices of the West Wing. In a departure from the usual team-writing approach to television drama, Sorkin alone wrote every episode for the first four seasons of the series. Though not immune to moments of cloying patriotism and sentimentalism, the series sustains a liberal sensibility and manages to realistically convey the murky complexities of decision-making and spin-doctoring in the American government. Cast includes Rob Lowe, Martin Sheen, Bradley Whitford, John Spencer, Allison Janney, Dule Hill, Richard Schiff, Moira Kelly.

results.title: The West Indies: Caribbean region 1
results.brief_description: Historical overview of the West Indies. Shows the principal West Indies Islands, their strategic and economic value to the western world, their topography, climate, industries, and the peoples who live there today.

results.title: The Wentworth Star

results.title: The Well of the saints
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A traditional Irish folk drama by John M. Synge, set in the east of Ireland, two or three centuries ago. The satiric theme - that sometimes it is better to preserve one’s illusions than to face reality - is expressed through the episode of Martin and Mary Doul’s miraculously restored sight. Part of the “Short play showcase” series.

results.title: The Well
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Samantha Lang, Sandra Levy, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Southern Star Entertainment

The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.
description_for_label: Hester (Pamela Rabe) is a lonely woman who has spent all her life on her father’s farm in outback NSW. Katherine (Miranda Otto), is a young woman alone in the world until she comes to live with Hester as her housemaid. The two form a happy friendship, until one night it all falls apart when Katherine runs over and kills a man. The haunting cinematography and strong acting performances produce a powerful tale of rural isolation and trust betrayed. Cinematography by Mandy Walker.
